reasoning: Rare juvenile soft tissue neoplasm, most common in hands and feet. Estimated <0.1 per 100k based on case reports and orthopedic registries. Fewer than 1000 documented cases worldwide.
source: Kransdorf MJ et al. (1991). Calcifying aponeurotic fibroma: radiologic appearance with pathologic correlation. Radiographics. 11(3):365-376
